content:
TimelineGroup Class

In this Article

Abstract class that, when implemented represents a Timeline that may contain a collection of child Timeline objects.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Windows.Markup.ContentProperty("Children")]
public abstract class TimelineGroup : System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline, System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DispatcherObject
  • DependencyObject
  • Freezable
  • Animatable
  • System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline
  • TimelineGroup

Remarks

A TimelineGroup can be a child of another TimelineGroup.

Constructors summary

TimelineGroup()

Initializes a new instance of the TimelineGroup class, with default properties.
TimelineGroup(Nullable<TimeSpan>)

Initializes a new instance of the TimelineGroup class with the specified stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.BeginTime*.
TimelineGroup(Nullable<TimeSpan>,Duration)

Initializes a new instance of the TimelineGroup class with the specified stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.BeginTime* and stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration*.
TimelineGroup(Nullable<TimeSpan>,Duration,RepeatBehavior)

Initializes a new instance of the TimelineGroup class with the specified stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.BeginTime*, stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration*, and stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior*.

Fields summary

ChildrenProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Animation.TimelineGroup.Children* dependency property.

Properties summary

Children

Gets or sets the collection of direct child Timeline objects of the TimelineGroup.

Methods summary

AddChild(Object)

Adds a child Timeline to this TimelineGroup.
AddText(String)

Adds a text string as a child of this Timeline.
AllocateClock()

Creates a type-specific clock for this timeline.
Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this TimelineGroup, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this TimelineGroup object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
CreateClock()

Instantiates a new ClockGroup object, using this instance.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IAddChild.AddChild(Object)

Adds a child object.
IAddChild.AddText(String)

Adds the text content of a node to the object.

  • TimelineGroup(Nullable<TimeSpan>,Duration,RepeatBehavior)

    Initializes a new instance of the TimelineGroup class with the specified stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.BeginTime*, stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration*, and stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior*.

    protected TimelineGroup (Nullable<TimeSpan> beginTime, System.Windows.Duration duration, System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior repeatBehavior);

    Parameters

    • beginTime

      The stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.BeginTime* for this TimelineGroup.

    • duration

    • repeatBehavior
      RepeatBehavior

      The stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior* for this TimelineGroup.

Fields

  • ChildrenProperty

    Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Animation.TimelineGroup.Children* dependency property.

    public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty ChildrenProperty;

    Remarks

    The identifier for the Children dependency property.

Properties

  • Children

    Gets or sets the collection of direct child Timeline objects of the TimelineGroup.

    public System.Windows.Media.Animation.TimelineCollection Children { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimelineCollection

      Child Timeline objects of the TimelineGroup. The default value is null.

    Remarks

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field ChildrenProperty
    Metadata properties set to true None

Methods

  • AddChild(Object)

    Adds a child Timeline to this TimelineGroup.

    protected virtual void AddChild (object child);

    Parameters

    • child
      Object

      The object to be added as the child of this TimelineGroup. If this object is a Timeline it will be added to the stem.Windows.Media.Animation.TimelineGroup.Children* collection; otherwise, an exception will be thrown.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The parameter child is not a Timeline.

  • AddText(String)

    Adds a text string as a child of this Timeline.

    protected virtual void AddText (string childText);

    Parameters

    • childText
      String

      The text added to the Timeline.

    Remarks

    A Timeline does not accept text as a child, so this method will raise an InvalididOperationException unless a derived class has overridden this behavior which allows text to be added.

  • AllocateClock()

    Creates a type-specific clock for this timeline.

    protected override System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock AllocateClock ();

    Returns

    • Clock

      A clock for this timeline.

    Remarks

    If a derived class overrides this method, it should only create and return an object of a class inheriting from Clock.

  • Clone()

    Creates a modifiable clone of this TimelineGroup, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

    public System.Windows.Media.Animation.TimelineGroup Clone ();

    Returns

    • TimelineGroup

      A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

    Remarks

    This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

    For more information, see Clone.

  • CloneCurrentValue()

    Creates a modifiable clone of this TimelineGroup object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

    public System.Windows.Media.Animation.TimelineGroup CloneCurrentValue ();

    Returns

    • TimelineGroup

      A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

    Remarks

    This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

    For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.

  • CreateClock()

    Instantiates a new ClockGroup object, using this instance.

    public System.Windows.Media.Animation.ClockGroup CreateClock ();

    Returns

    • ClockGroup

      A ClockGroup object.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • IAddChild.AddChild(Object)

    Adds a child object.

    void IAddChild.AddChild (object child);

    Parameters

    • child
      Object

      The child object to add.

  • IAddChild.AddText(String)

    Adds the text content of a node to the object.

    void IAddChild.AddText (string childText);

    Parameters

    • childText
      String

      The text to add to the object.
